kummins.file

Class DirTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • kummins.file.DirTools

  • public abstract class DirTools
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides basic directory tools to emulate the function of various bash commands, such as 'ls' and 'pwd'.
    Author:
    Chris Cummins

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DirTools() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String ls(java.lang.String directory, java.lang.String delimiter)
      Similar in use to bash command 'ls', returns a String containing the directory contents, separated by the delimiter.
      static java.lang.String lsa(java.lang.String directory, java.lang.String delimiter)
      Similar in use to bash command 'ls -a', returns a String containing the directory contents.
      static java.io.File[] lsaToFiles(java.lang.String directory)
      Similar in use to bash command 'ls -a', returns an array of Files representing the directory contents.
      static java.lang.String[] lsaToStrings(java.lang.String directory)
      Similar in use to bash command 'ls -a', returns an array of strings representing the directory contents.
      static java.lang.String lsd(java.lang.String directory, java.lang.String delimiter)
      Similar in use to bash command 'ls', returns a string containing the subdirectories.
      static java.io.File[] lsdToFiles(java.lang.String directory)
      Similar in use to bash command 'ls', returns an array of Files containing the subdirectories of the argument.
      static java.lang.String[] lsdToStrings(java.lang.String directory)
      Similar in use to bash command 'ls', returns an array of Strings containing the subdirectories of the argument.
      static java.io.File[] lsToFiles(java.lang.String directory)
      Similar in use to bash command 'ls', returns an array of Files representing the directory contents.
      static java.lang.String[] lsToStrings(java.lang.String directory)
      Similar in use to bash command 'ls', returns an array of strings representing the directory contents.
      static java.lang.String pwd()
      Returns the current directory as a string, similar to bash 'pwd' command.

    • Method Detail

      • lsToStrings

        public static java.lang.String[] lsToStrings(java.lang.String directory)
        Similar in use to bash command 'ls', returns an array of strings representing the directory contents. Excludes Linux hidden files and directories (beginning with a '.').
        Parameters:
        directory - Directory to list contents of.
        Returns:
        String array.

      • lsToFiles

        public static java.io.File[] lsToFiles(java.lang.String directory)
        Similar in use to bash command 'ls', returns an array of Files representing the directory contents. Excludes Linux hidden files and directories (beginning with a '.').
        Parameters:
        directory - Directory to list contents of.
        Returns:
        File array.

      • ls

        public static java.lang.String ls(java.lang.String directory,
                  java.lang.String delimiter)
        Similar in use to bash command 'ls', returns a String containing the directory contents, separated by the delimiter. Excludes Linux hidden files and directories (beginning with a '.').
        Parameters:
        directory - Directory to list contents of.
        delimiter - Delimiter between entries.
        Returns:
        String.

      • lsaToStrings

        public static java.lang.String[] lsaToStrings(java.lang.String directory)
        Similar in use to bash command 'ls -a', returns an array of strings representing the directory contents.
        Parameters:
        directory - Directory to list contents of.
        Returns:
        Array of Strings.

      • lsaToFiles

        public static java.io.File[] lsaToFiles(java.lang.String directory)
        Similar in use to bash command 'ls -a', returns an array of Files representing the directory contents.
        Parameters:
        directory - Directory to list contents of.
        Returns:
        Array of Files.
